## hiccup-svg package

## Variables

|  Variable | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [circle](./hiccup-svg.circle.md) |  |
|  [convertTree](./hiccup-svg.converttree.md) | Takes a normalized hiccup tree of  or  shape definitions and recursively converts it into an hiccup flavor which is compatible for SVG serialization. This conversion also involves translation &amp; reorg of various attributes. Returns new tree. The original remains untouched, as will any unrecognized tree/shape nodes. |
|  [defs](./hiccup-svg.defs.md) |  |
|  [ellipse](./hiccup-svg.ellipse.md) |  |
|  [fattribs](./hiccup-svg.fattribs.md) | Takes an attributes object and converts any <code>fill</code>, <code>stroke</code> or transformation attributes, i.e. <code>transform</code>, <code>rotate</code>, <code>scale</code>, <code>translate</code>. If the element has a <code>transform</code> attrib, conversion of the other attribs will be skipped, else the values are assumed to be either strings or:<!-- -->- <code>transform</code>: 6-element numeric array (mat23) - <code>translate</code>: 2-element array - <code>rotate</code>: number (angle in radians) - <code>scale</code>: number (uniform scale) or 2-elem array<!-- -->If no <code>transform</code> is given, the resulting transformation order will always be TRS. Any string values given will be used as-is and therefore need to be complete, e.g. <code>{ rotate: &quot;rotate(60)&quot; }</code>For color related attribs (<code>fill</code>, <code>stroke</code>), if given value is array-like, a number or an [IColor](./color.icolor.md) instance, it will be converted into a CSS color string using .<!-- -->String color attribs prefixed with <code>$</code> are replaced with <code>url(#...)</code> refs (used for referencing gradients).<!-- -->Returns updated attribs or <code>undefined</code> if <code>attribs</code> itself is null-ish. |
|  [fcolor](./hiccup-svg.fcolor.md) | Attempts to convert a single color attrib value.[fattribs](./hiccup-svg.fattribs.md) |
|  [ff](./hiccup-svg.ff.md) |  |
|  [fpoint](./hiccup-svg.fpoint.md) |  |
|  [fpoints](./hiccup-svg.fpoints.md) |  |
|  [group](./hiccup-svg.group.md) |  |
|  [hline](./hiccup-svg.hline.md) |  |
|  [image](./hiccup-svg.image.md) |  |
|  [line](./hiccup-svg.line.md) |  |
|  [linearGradient](./hiccup-svg.lineargradient.md) |  |
|  [path](./hiccup-svg.path.md) |  |
|  [points](./hiccup-svg.points.md) | Shape instancing group. The <code>shape</code> can be an SVG shape <code>#id</code> defined elsewhere in the document or set to <code>circle</code> or <code>rect</code> (default). The <code>size</code> arg is only used for the latter two shape types and defines the radius or width respectively. |
|  [polygon](./hiccup-svg.polygon.md) |  |
|  [polyline](./hiccup-svg.polyline.md) |  |
|  [radialGradient](./hiccup-svg.radialgradient.md) |  |
|  [rect](./hiccup-svg.rect.md) |  |
|  [roundedRect](./hiccup-svg.roundedrect.md) |  |
|  [setPrecision](./hiccup-svg.setprecision.md) |  |
|  [svg](./hiccup-svg.svg.md) | Defines an <svg> root element with default XML namespaces. By default currently still sets SVG version to 1.1 to support Safari and other legacy tooling. |
|  [text](./hiccup-svg.text.md) |  |
|  [vline](./hiccup-svg.vline.md) |  |
